section.name: Abstract Concept
section.summary:
One way to think of the research process is as an interconnected flow of data.

Data is at the heart of all aspects of research. Considering the research process through a data lens can therefore create high quality, efficient and impactful research.

Questions to consider include:

    • what data is needed, wanted, feasible to collect;
    • who owns or will own the data - what does data ownership mean and what are its boundaries;
    • who will have (what level of) access to the data and when;
    • how data will be collected - by whom and why;
    • how data will be stored, managed, transformed - by whom and why;
    • how data will be analysed and interpreted - by whom and why;
    • what the data will be used for;
    • how data quality will be assured and assessed - what will ensure the data is both valid and reliable;
    • what data related opportunities and risks are there.
